fields.description:
1. Save an attachment which has spaces in the name, e.g. typical word document
2. Try to click on this attachment within the issue.

Expected:
The attachment is downloaded/opened/displayed

Actual:
A page displays the 'Internal Server Error'

Notes:
I noticed that the internal server error page displayed the path to the attachment with %20 where there were spaces.  Manually removing these and pressing enter does download the attachment.  This is a temporary workaround but not long term given the volume of usage we are getting. Observed this with both Chrome & Firefox
fields.summary: Clicking on an attachment with spaces produces an Internal Server error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35857].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Start with JIRA < 6.2-OD-3/icebat-85.0.
# Create a custom issue status, which is created with an ID of 10000.
# Upgrade to JIRA 6.2-OD-3/icebat-85.0.
# Try to create another issue status, and you'll receive a stack trace:
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Status][id,10000][sequence,12][description,null][name,A New Status][statuscategory,1][iconurl,/images/icons/statuses/generic.png] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.issuestatus (ID, SEQUENCE, pname, DESCRIPTION, ICONURL, STATUSCATEGORY) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_issuestatus"))
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.createValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:395)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.createValue(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:219)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.AbstractIssueConstantsManager.createConstant(AbstractIssueConstantsManager.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultStatusManager.createStatus(DefaultStatusManager.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.config.DefaultStatusService.createStatus(DefaultStatusService.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.statuses.ViewStatuses.addConstant(ViewStatuses.java:196)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.constants.AbstractViewConstants.doAddConstant(AbstractViewConstants.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.statuses.ViewStatuses.doAddStatus(ViewStatuses.java:134)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
[...]
{code}

Try to create it a second time and it'll work fine, as the new status is then created with an ID of 10001. The more custom issue statuses already exist in an instance, the more times you have to click Add in order to get past the latest ID.

h3. Workaround
If on OnDemand contact support, support will:

# Shutdown JIRA
# Backup the database
# Identify the current maximum value of the issuestatus id
{noformat}
select id::integer from issuestatus order by id desc limit 1;
{noformat}
# Update the sequence_value_item table to define the Status sequence ID as 1 higher than the value identified in the previous step
{noformat}
update sequence_value_item set seq_id = <value from above + 1> where seq_name = 'Status';
{noformat}
# Start JIRA back up.
fields.summary: JIRA unable to create statuses after upgrade to 6.2-OD-3/icebat-85.0 if there's previously been custom statuses created

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35851].
  {panel}

When you are sent an email notification for a changed issue, if that issue includes a change to a free text field, the content in that field doesn't wrap. 
Consequently, the user can end up doing significant horizontal scrolling to read the changes.

The attachments show the definition of the product notes as well as how the email comes across. 

This email happens to being shown on a very large, 24" screen. 

The user should not have to scroll horizontally as the content should wrap.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35842].
  {panel}

We have a base template of issues that we use for all of our projects within Target and then add additional issues as needed based on the project details itself.  It would be helpful to have a way to easily replicate this template.  
1) Either through importing from a source (after potential exporting from a set of data).
2) Perhaps a better option, creating a new "bulk change" feature with the option to "clone" a set of selected issues.  It is critical that the workflow be maintained that is being used by the rest of the projects within the Jira instance.  Also the issue type, etc.  Also it should ask if we want to show that this was cloned from something or not, so we don't have to go into each and remove the "cloned" references.  But could maintain them if desired.  These should look like a set of new issues when we are done.  We would like the option to set the "project", "version" and "Epic" they are assigned to.  Things like components, priority, should retain the values in the original, and assignee should be the default for the project we are cloning the issues to.  Ideally it would ask questions on these fields (retain or set to a new value).

The goal being to create an easier way to set-up a base set of issues for a project.
fields.summary: issue template replication

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35824].
  {panel}

When I install an application from scratch I want to know that everything worked as expected. However when I install JIRA and there is no problem I still get various kinds of warnings. I even get an error that isn't really an error!

I'm not going to list out all the warnings and the error here because they've each been reported before over the past few years. Instead I'm going to submit this as an Improvement, or perhaps even as a Challenge for the JIRA team: 

"A JIRA install that works as expected must have no warnings or errors"

This would have the major benefit that when there are problems they are less likely to get ignored by JIRA administrators. It will be easier for Support to ignore what is irrelevant in the log files. I won't have to explain to customers repeatedly that they don't have to worry about those warnings and that error.
fields.summary: Why does a perfect JIRA install give me warnings and an error?
When editing the title, the save/cancel controls are covered up by the Share/Export buttons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35821].
  {panel}

As an Jira user I want to see the default transaction action highlighted differently than the other ones.

Obviously the default transaction depends on each workflow and we define it a the most likely transaction from the current state. Probably this should be the the first one but not necessarly.

Now, if the workflow designer could add a property to mark the default transaction, this could be transposed to a CSS class, or even an extended HTML attribute, allowing the customization via CSS rules.

This is the request to allow us to define attributes that will reach the generated HTML code in order to be able to CSS mark the default button. 

The proposed solution it generic enough in order allow other use cases and without risking on impacting current implementation.
fields.summary: Allow CSS customizations of transaction buttons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35797].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed a vulnerability in JIRA which allowed unauthenticated attackers to commit actions on behalf of any other authorised user. In order to exploit this vulnerability, an attacker requires access to JIRA web interface.

The vulnerability affects all supported versions of JIRA up to and including 6.1.3. It has been fixed in 6.1.4. 

For more information, see our [security advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2014-02-26].

Patches are available at 

JIRA 4.4.5: http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-35797-4.4.5-20140303.zip
JIRA 5.0.7: http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-35797-5.0.7-20140303.zip
JIRA 5.1.8: http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-35797-5.1.8.zip
JIRA 5.2.11: http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-35797-5.2.11-20140303.zip
JIRA 6.0.8: http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-35797-6.0.8.zip

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35776].
  {panel}

I manage a multiple, but related, development teams. We use a project for my organization, and components for each of the sub teams.

I have one amazing dashboard which I use to enable team members to know what to focus on, both in terms of top defects and stories for our currently Agile sprints (we use the green hopper plug in). We update our dashboard with changes to gadgets at least every 2 weeks based on sprint changes, defect changes, etc.


Given that I have such a large team, the overall view is helpful for me, but a filtered view is what I would like to be able for users to set as their default.

So for instance, if I could apply a filter "Project=AM and Component=Hello" to all gadgets that are based off filters in the dashboard, then all users that are only working on component Hello automatically would get to focus just on their small piece of the pie instead of the whole picture.


I cannot maintain multiple dashboards since overall company priorities change often, so we need a way to filter one dashboard so that a user can have a filtered view of the dashboard I want them to use as per my organizational goals.
fields.summary: Allow filter to be applied to all gadgets in a dashboard

We currently use Jira for our dev team and we also use Jira Agile and are on a trial of Service Desk.

I would like to use all 3, but the way the pricing works it doesn't make sense for us, because we need to pay for all users to use Agile and Service desk as well.  Only 1/3 of our users needs Agile, 1/3 need Service Desk, and 1/3 need just Jira.

Please consider offering user tiers that do not force you to upgrade all 3 products.

Thanks,

Jen Campbell

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35762].
  {panel}

h3. The problem
Some of the most common causes of issues with proxy integration, such as [Apache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache+using+SSL], are related to misconfiguration into the {{server.xml}} file. Follow there are some KBs illustrating some very common issues:

* [Login Gadget and Dashboard Does not Work when Running behind a Load Balancer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Login+Gadget+and+Dashboard+Does+not+Work+when+Running+behind+a+Load+Balancer]
* [Gadgets do not Display Correctly when Using SSL and Proxy Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Gadgets+do+not+Display+Correctly+when+Using+SSL+and+Proxy+Server]

h3. Proposed fix
Parameters such as _scheme_, _proxyName_ and _proxyPort_ should be included into [JIRA Configuration Tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool#UsingtheJIRAConfigurationTool-ConfiguringJIRA%27swebserver]. Also, it would be good to have a way to test the configuration in the same screen.
fields.summary: Include proxy settings into JIRA Configuration Tool

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35749].
  {panel}

The commonly use tab for Fisheye/Stash commits to be linked together with an issue in JIRA would be the *Source tab*. However, the *Commits tab* is telling the user that you would need to configure Fisheye when looking into the *Commits tab*.

To reproduce using Fisheye
# Configure JIRA and Fisheye
# Configure Application Link between the two
# Create a DEMO project in JIRA
# Commits to Fisheye with issuekey DEMO-1
# Open both tabs to see the following

Source tab:
!fish2.png|thumbnail!
Commits tab:
!fish1.png|thumbnail!

Expected behaviour:
JIRA should mention that Fisheye / Stash are already configured and if the commits are only visible in the Source tab, it should point to the right tab.
fields.summary: Source and Commits tabs need to convey more clearer message
Possibility to define a parent version in 'Manage Versions' view

fields.description:
I accidently opened a ticket (CONF-31507) which I replied can be marked as resolved for Confluence. The issue is with the new version of JIRA 6.1.2 users who leveraged adding Screen Shot as a attachment no longer can get this to work. 

We initially thought it was an issue with our browser version, but narrowed down the issue is with JAVA. Need to figure out a resolution for what this problem is and how to fix/resolve it since people want to use this feature to include items from their clipboard in cases instead of doing a print/screen, copying it to a file and uploading the attachment that way.
fields.summary: Print screen attachments in JIRA not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35737].
  {panel}

A link inside this document [Federating JIRA - Managing Multiple Instances|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ATLAS/Federating+JIRA+-+Managing+Multiple+Instances] is pointing to the page itself.

This is the paragraph:

h3. Remote Issue Links

bq. Linking issues is crucial to connecting relevant JIRA issues. With [remote links|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+Remote+Issue+Links], you can not only track dependencies and other relations of issues to other local projects, but to remote projects in other instances as well. See [our example|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ATLAS/Federating+JIRA+-+Managing+Multiple+Instances] about how we connect issues in JAC (JIRA.Atlassian.com) with internal development tickets in our JDOG instance.

The link 'our example' is pointing to the page itself, should it be pointing to? 

* [JIRA Remote Issue Links|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+Remote+Issue+Links]

Please review at your convenience ;)
fields.summary: Update our 'Federating JIRA - Managing Multiple Instances' page
Support non-standard location of Bash

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35730].
  {panel}

I originally filed https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=421297 with Eclipse.  They closed it, pointing out that the stack trace included "com.atlassian.jira.rest.client" and told me to file this with Atlassian.  From the product list, I don't see anything closer than JIRA.  I'm just repeating the same report here, with some additional information.

I have a Kepler workspace that I've been using for a while. I've had the JIRA connector installed and running for a long time.

Today was the first time I created some projects from a cloned git workspace.  Sometime after the first project was created, I started to get error dialogs popping up every few minutes saying 'An internal error occurred during "Synchronizing Task List".'  This continued to happen while I had those git projects in my workspace.  After several hours of this, the error dialog popping up every synch interval, I then deleted all of the git projects.  I don't know if that's exactly what's causing the conflict, but now there are no more error dialogs.  I'm going to be checking out those projects again in the next few days.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35725].
  {panel}

Advanced search using project name is impossible if the name used is equal to other project's key.

h3. How to reproduce
# Create 2 project with below details:
** Project name: Awesome | Key: AWE
** Project name: Awesomeness | Key: AWESOME
# Create 1 issue in each project
# Go to JIRA advanced search and search below queries(the value is selected from JIRA own suggestion/autocomplete):
** project = Awesome
** project = Awesomeness
# Both will only show result for project *Awesomeness*

The only way to search project *Awesome* is by using key in quote "AWE".

(i) If project *Awesomeness* is not browsable, JIRA will throw error message for JQL that try to search content for project *Awesome* using suggested value:
bq. The value 'Awesome' does not exist for the field 'project'.

h4. Check attached video.
fields.summary: Advanced search using project name is impossible if the name used is equal to other project's key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35724].
  {panel}

As of now, proxy configuration is catered for *Apache* even though it is not officially supported. There are several documentations for *Apache* but not for *NGINX*:
* [Integrating JIRA with Apache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache]
* [Using Apache with mod_proxy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Using+Apache+with+mod_proxy]
* [Integrating JIRA with Apache using SSL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache+using+SSL]

NGINXis one of the most popular proxies as of now. Hence, it would be really nice to have some documentation that can assist the users to at least a rough configuration.
fields.summary: Documentation for integration between JIRA and NGINX

fields.description:
I used the image uploader tool to upload an image to my issue.

After uploading, there was no indication that the upload had failed, or that the image was available to use.

Chetan Paul added a workaround to [Attaching a Screenshot|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Attaching+a+Screenshot?focusedCommentId=305037647#comment-305037647] documentation.

If you attach the image a second time, the second image finally appears as the sole attachment.

Can you make the image uploader work properly the first time?
fields.summary: Have to upload image twice to see it in attachments
Filter automatically update whenever issue transitioned via detail view
Disable regex checking of project pattern keys

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35712].
  {panel}

The new workflow designer is nice in some ways, but there are several serious flaws.

* Lack of ability to adjust horizontal and vertical position of arrows
* Lack of ability to add control points to arrows for routing
* Lack of ability to move labels
* Routing does not work around existing states, instead it runs right through them

Overall this is a step back from the 6.0 "classic" version, which is saying a lot.

For a complex workflow, of which I am responsible for many, routing is a major challenge, and the visualization for users is very confusing because I can't tailor it to add clarity.
fields.summary: Cannot move arrows or labels in workflow designer

fields.description:
When adding a new link to Confluence, a blank page is displayed. The application link works fine in all other cases. The log file shows no evidence.

Is there any evidence which can this error come about?

Reproduced in two different combinations Jira and Confluence. Upgrade to the latest version have been made and have brought no improvement.

Thanks for your help!
Regards
fields.summary: JIRA link to Confluence Page are broken / blank Site

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35708].
  {panel}

h4. Problem Description

When trying to make a custom field required during a transition of a workflow and this custom field has the same name of a system field, JIRA seems to be ignoring it as an option to be chosen. For example, the "Resolution" field exists in JIRA by default, so if we create a custom field called "Resolution", it won't show up on that list. The system only displays its own "Resolution" field. If the user is trying to make this custom field required and end up choosing the one displayed on the list, nothing happens.

h4. Workaround

As a workaround you can rename the custom field (e.g. Resolution 2). Once you rename it, JIRA will start showing this field up as an option and the validator will work as expected.
fields.summary: If a user names a custom field with a system fields name, JIRA fails to display it as an option to be a validator/condition.

Bulk delete Multiple Projects
Provide The Ability to Search Mentioned Confluence Page using JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35695].
  {panel}

As a Product Owner/Product Manager, I would like to have reports/stats/gadgets for the total time spent per issue type, project, assignee for a given time period.

I'm particularly interested in the report/gadget by issue type.

ex. Gadget: new pie chart for time spent
Bugs - 35% of the time spent by all the team for project x
User Story - 40% of the time spent by all the team for project x
Improvement - 25% of the time spent by all the team for project x
option to choose between showing the total sum in hours or % is useful
fields.summary: Reports/Stats/Gadgets for total time spent per issue type, project, assignee etc for a given period of time

fields.description:
# There is no error in catalina.out
# There is no Post function or validator or condition for that transition, its a simple transition
# all mandatory fields of the CR have a value.
# on clicking of the workflow action, the processing symbol keeps on rotating but finally after a long time the request times out saying
"The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser"
# after this error, even if I refresh the page, the issue still stays in same old state.
# Also, we noticed that submission Edit page or adding a comment also keeps on showing processing symbol without any result. but in these case a page refresh will show the new values of the Edited fields and the new comment added. But change history doesnt show any updates done.
fields.summary: Cannot transition an issue
Allow additional custom field for Versions
